meanings.definition: To remove or undo the head of something.
meanings.sent1: I will unhead the doll to see how it works.
meanings.sent2: Please unhead the screw before attaching the new handle.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally unheaded the Lego figure, and now it won't stay together!
meanings.sent4: The gardener had to unhead the wilting flowers to promote new growth.
meanings.sent5: In order to fix the broken toy, you must unhead the damaged part carefully.

meanings.definition: To be unaware or ignorant of something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to unhead important details in her rush to finish tasks.
meanings.sent2: Don't unhead the warning signs just because you're in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: I always unhead the expiration date on food items, and end up regretting it later.
meanings.sent4: He unheads the consequences of his actions, leading to frequent mistakes.
meanings.sent5: It's dangerous to unhead the rules of the road while driving.
